clauses.description: reindex returns a DataFrame conformed to the requested labels.
Labels introduced by reindex are NaN by default when values are missing.
fill_value replaces missing values introduced by reindex.
fill_value supports non-numeric compatible values.
clauses.unsatisfied_reason: No test explicitly verifies fill_value with non-numeric compatible values like 'missing'

clauses.description: method='ffill'/'pad' propagates last valid observation forward.
method='bfill'/'backfill' propagates next valid observation backward.
method='nearest' fills gaps using nearest valid observation.
method-based filling applies only to monotonic indexes.
method-based filling does not fill pre-existing NaN values in the original DataFrame.
limit caps the maximum number of consecutive forward/backward fills.
DataFrame.reindex supports keyword convention using index= and columns=.
DataFrame.reindex supports labels with explicit axis convention.
axis accepts both axis names and numeric selectors.
clauses.unsatisfied_reason: No test explicitly verifies axis accepts numeric selectors (0, 1)

clauses.description: columns reindexing may introduce NaN for missing columns.
Scalar tolerance applies uniformly to all values.
clauses.unsatisfied_reason: No test explicitly verifies scalar tolerance applies uniformly to all values

clauses.description: List-like tolerance must match index size and exact index dtype.
clauses.unsatisfied_reason: No test explicitly verifies list-like tolerance requirements

clauses.description: Tolerance matching follows the absolute-distance inequality.
clauses.unsatisfied_reason: No test explicitly verifies tolerance matching inequality

clauses.description: level performs matching across the specified MultiIndex level.
copy keyword is ignored and has no effect on method behavior.
clauses.unsatisfied_reason: No test explicitly verifies copy keyword is ignored

clauses.description: Using Index objects for labels/index/columns is preferred to avoid data duplication.
clauses.unsatisfied_reason: No test explicitly verifies Index objects are preferred to avoid data duplication
